title: Thunderbird synchronization
content:
If I have synchronized my email host to Thunderbird locally, THEN switch to a new email host (where my IMAP on the new host is empty), will Thunderbird then synchronize everything stored locally from the old host UP to my new host? Assuming, of course, that I change my connection settings in Thunderbird from my old host to my new email host.

I am transitioning from Google Workspace to an IMAP email hosted by InMotion Hosting. Wish me luck.
creator: chuckwb9

title: ログインについて
content: メールアドレスとパスワードを入力しても「サーバーにログインできません」と出てしまいます。 原因や対処法についてお聞きしたくご連絡しました。 先週金曜日(9/5)にも同様の問い合わせをしております。 ご返信お待ちしております。

creator: ThurstonOR

title: Incoming server already exists.
content:
Hi,


Thunderbird: 142.0 (64-bit)

With Account Hub

When I try to add a mail account that I deleted before, I receive an error message:

  • Error Creating Account
  • Incoming server already exists.

When I add my email account, I receive the message, "Can't find a server," and Thunderbird adds the incoming server configuration somewhere. It's not in the "Account Settings" menu.

Without Account Hub

I deleted my profile folder and started from scratch.

I tried to use the same configuration settings I have in the mobile version of Thunderbird, but without success. Unfortunately, it's not possible to import the settings from Thunderbird Mobile.

I have the same problem with the Account Hub, or without it. How can I fix this problem?

Many thanks,
creator: jose_ze

title: Adding SPAM folder to THUNDERBIRD POP account

What can I do to fix that easily?

Thank you.

Jean-Pierre

title: Thunderbird calendar
content: Hello there! I have v. 142 on two notebooks and I want to export the calendar from the one to other. I use: right click -> Export or Event & Tasks - > Export. Both create a file around 1Mb. When I open (File -> Open Calendar) it it seems empty and when importing it an error occurred (nothing to import something). What I am doing wrong. Thank you in advance.
creator: ngatsis

title: Error updating Pop3 email account
content:
Hi Support,

have been running Thunderbird for half a year, no issues, suddently last week, I get an error on one of my POP3 accounts in same Thunderbird program.

Error reads "Kunne ikke skrive mailen i mailmappen. Sørg for at du har skriverettigheder til filsystemet, og at du har nok diskpladstil at kopiere mailmappen"

According to my provider, it is a problem with my email program.

I have tried to compress, archieve to generate more room, even restartet, program and computer. Still same issue. Still have 23 GB of free disk spare on my drive.

Any ideas

Marinus
creator: marinus6

title: The messages could not be moved or copied to folder 'MyFolder on Local Folders' because writing to folder failed.
content:
Hi.

Every and each time I try to move any message to my local folders, or make any change on it, I get that error message. I can create new folders inside my Local Folders (for instance, a Test folder) and I can still access the messages stored there, but I can not make any further change.

I have tried these things so far:

1 - Check that I have enough space on the partition. 2 - Check the access privileges (I have set them to Total Control to all users). 3 - Compact all mail folders. 4 - Repair all mail folders. 5 - Rename the Local Folders to "Local Folders.old" and create a new one. 6 - Place the local folders in a different drive. 7 - Recreate the profile, either by copying the files manually and by importing them. 8 - Uninstall and reinstall Thunderbird from scratch to the last version - 142.0 (64-bit) 9 - Revert the last W10 system update. 10 - Check the antivirus configuration. 11 - Recover an old backup of my Mail folder (done when there was no error). 12 - Delete the entire disk data partition, reformat and recover it.

The error persists and I have run out of ideas.

Could someone help me, please? At my local folders I have years of messages that I still browse, and I use them as a local archive.

Thank you very much in advance.

Iskandar.
creator: iskandar.101

title: BUG ? XML anchor displayed in Thunderbird
content:
Hello,

When I receive e-mails with this content :

<xml> 

    <o:officedocumentsettings>                <o:allowpng></o:AllowPNG>                <o:pixelsperinch>96</o:PixelsPerInch>           </o:OfficeDocumentSettings>

</xml>

The "96" (from <o:pixelsperinch>) is displayed in the HTML view in Thunderbird ! Is that normal ?

Thanks Fred Pralong
creator: buddycat75

title: Email notifications not working (KDE, Microsoft Exchange account)
content:
I'm not getting notifications for received mail. Thunderbird 142 on Fedora Linux KDE, Microsoft Exchange email account. The emails arrive but I get no notification. Calendar notifications work fine.

In the settings I have enabled "Show an alert" when new messages arrive, and "Use the system notification". Unchecking "Use the system notification" does not help, still no notifications.

I think this is a critical issue, as I may miss important work emails.

Have not found any discussion or solution to the problem.
creator: t-m

content:

Idem sul mio pc, ho rimosso un account e lo vorrei reimpostare, ma succede la stessa cosa, è impossibile procedere.

Suggerimenti?

title: The Add Contact to Address book action works but it isnt recognised.
content:
This problem only occurs on some emails, not all. The normal behavior to add a new email person to my address book was to right click on the email address in the email header and select "Add to Address Book". The email is added to the address book. After I add the contact, I can then right-click again and select EDIT contact. Even though the contact is added correctly, Thunderbird doesnt seem to be aware that it happened. Even if I restart the software. So if I right-click on the contact, the Add Contact choice is still there and there is no EDIT contact choice.

Cant figure out what is wrong.
creator: cmmguy

title: New account setup gets stuck on all our PCs
content:
Hello All, We've used Thunderbird for a long time now. We recently added a few more computers to the office.

When we try to add an email account via File>New>Email Account We fill in the two fields and click to proceed and the swirling circle just keeps going forever.

As a test we tried to add extra email accounts to our existing computers and the same thing happens.

All thunderbird versions are: 140.2.1esr (64-bit)

When i google this problem it suggests adjusting the firewalls or antivirus settings. It just seems strange that this problem would start all of a sudden.

thank you for any help. zac
creator: zacwingfield
